required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

lead_sponsor.agency: Medtronic Cardiac Rhythm and Heart Failure

clinical_study.source: Medtronic Cardiac Rhythm and Heart Failure

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to assess lead implant success and complication rate using the Medtronic Attain Family of left-heart leads and delivery catheters.

primary_outcome.measure: Subjects Successfully Implanted With an Attain Family Left-heart Lead Using an Attain Family Delivery Catheter
primary_outcome.description: Implant success was defined as final successful placement of the Attain Family left-heart lead in the coronary vein branches utilizing the Attain Family of delivery catheters.

primary_outcome.measure: Subjects Without a Left-heart Lead and Delivery Catheter Related Complication
primary_outcome.description: A left-heart lead and delivery related complication was defined as a complication, an adverse event that resulted in death, any termination of significant device function or invasive intervention, that resulted from the presence of or performance (intended or otherwise) of the Medtronic left-heart lead or Attain Family of delivery catheters. All adverse events were adjudicated by an Adverse Event Advisory Committee (AEAC).

study_pop.textblock: Patient referral to a participating study center with practitioners experienced in handling and implantation of the cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT) device, the left-heart lead, and the use of the delivery catheter.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject is at least 18 years of age or older
- Subject will be implanted with Medtronic cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT) device and Medtronic left heart lead utilizing (or attempting to utilize) Attain Family of delivery catheters. The implant procedure may include upgrades to CRT from implantable pulse generator (IPG) or implantable cardioverter-defibrillator (ICD).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject is enrolled in a concurrent study with the exception of a study approved by the Medtronic Clinical Trial Leader prior to enrollment
- Subject has existing CRT system implanted or was previously implanted with a CRT system.

overall_official.affiliation: Davis Heart & Lung Research Institute, The Ohio State University

group.title: Attain Family Left Heart Lead
group.description: Subjects who underwent an Attain Family lead implant after either an Attain Family catheter attempt or any catheter model attempt

participants_list.participants: Total number of subjects with an Attain Family lead attempt after an Attain Family catheter attempt
Total number of subjects with successful Attain Family lead using Attain Family catheter

group.title: Attain Family Lead
group.description: Subjects who underwent an Attain Family lead implant after either an Attain Family catheter attempt or any catheter model attempt

outcome.title: Subjects Successfully Implanted With an Attain Family Left-heart Lead Using an Attain Family Delivery Catheter
outcome.description: Implant success was defined as final successful placement of the Attain Family left-heart lead in the coronary vein branches utilizing the Attain Family of delivery catheters.

group.title: Attain Family Lead and Catheter Attempt
group.description: Subjects who were attempted with an Attain Family left-heart lead after successful coronary sinus (CS) cannulation with an Attain Family catheter were included in this analysis as well as subjects who had unsuccessful CS cannulation with an Attain Family delivery catheter.

measure.title: Subjects Successfully Implanted With an Attain Family Left-heart Lead Using an Attain Family Delivery Catheter
measure.description: Implant success was defined as final successful placement of the Attain Family left-heart lead in the coronary vein branches utilizing the Attain Family of delivery catheters.

outcome.title: Subjects Without a Left-heart Lead and Delivery Catheter Related Complication
outcome.description: A left-heart lead and delivery related complication was defined as a complication, an adverse event that resulted in death, any termination of significant device function or invasive intervention, that resulted from the presence of or performance (intended or otherwise) of the Medtronic left-heart lead or Attain Family of delivery catheters. All adverse events were adjudicated by an Adverse Event Advisory Committee (AEAC).

group.title: Attain Family Lead Attempt, Any Catheter
group.description: Subjects who were attempted with Attain Family delivery catheters or Attain Family left-heart leads were included in this analysis.

measure.title: Subjects Without a Left-heart Lead and Delivery Catheter Related Complication
measure.description: A left-heart lead and delivery related complication was defined as a complication, an adverse event that resulted in death, any termination of significant device function or invasive intervention, that resulted from the presence of or performance (intended or otherwise) of the Medtronic left-heart lead or Attain Family of delivery catheters. All adverse events were adjudicated by an Adverse Event Advisory Committee (AEAC).

reported_events.desc: All new and/or worsening adverse events related to the left heart leads and left heart delivery catheters were collected through the 3 month visit. Event collection began when the subject was enrolled in the study and underwent a left-heart lead implant attempt.

group.title: Attain Family Lead
group.description: All new and/or worsening adverse events related to the left-heart leads and left-heart lead delivery catheters were collected through the 3 month visit. Event collection started once the subject enrolled in the study and underwent a left-heart lead implant attempt.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
